module.description: The class of modules that involve gene regulation.
An induced production of a repressor, where the repressor also inhibits its own production.
An induced production of a repressor, where the repressor also activates its own production. Can be bistable for certain parameter ranges.
The input regulator positively and negatively regulates the output protein's production, depending on the concentration level of the input.
Bistable switch involving two transcription factors that repress each other's promoters.
The class of modules where the input-output response curve is a sigmoid (depends on parameters too)
A process where the input Kinase phosphorylates the output protein and another phosphatase dephosphorylates the output protein.
An induced production of a repressor, where the repressor also activates its own production. Can be bistable for certain parameter ranges.
The class of modules where the system can exist in one of two stable states (depends on parameters too)
A process where the input Kinase phosphorylates the output protein and another phosphatase dephosphorylates the output protein.
An induced production of a repressor, where the repressor also activates its own production. Can be bistable for certain parameter ranges.
Bistable switch involving two transcription factors that repress each other's promoters.
The class of networks where there is some form of feedback
The class of modules where the output molecule regulates itself
An induced production of a repressor, where the repressor also inhibits its own production.
An induced production of a repressor, where the repressor also activates its own production. Can be bistable for certain parameter ranges.
Bistable switch involving two transcription factors that repress each other's promoters.
